head.title: A Run for Chancellor Gets Cut Short

hedline.hl1: A Run for Chancellor Gets Cut Short

block.p: Two days after saying he wanted to be New York City schools chancellor and throwing the selection process into turmoil, Irving S. Hamer Jr. was barred from seeking the post. He was told that he had applied too late.

Two days after saying he wanted to be New York City schools chancellor and throwing the selection process into turmoil, Irving S. Hamer Jr. was barred from seeking the post. He was told that he had applied too late.

Nevertheless, Mr. Hamer said he would withhold his support from the front-runner, Harold O. Levy, leaving Mr. Levy one vote short of the majority needed to get elected by the Board of Education. Article, Page B5.
